result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis E Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, also to pay all ordered financial obligations in count 2, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

records.addlTxt: Per Probation Agent, defendant being revoked.  Probation review hearing of 3-11-2016 cancelled.
Per email from Probation Agent, probation review hearing scheduled for 3-11-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.

Defendant Luis E Torres in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
No reply from defendant/surety.  sb

Defendant Luis E Torres in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Luis E Torres in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has a new charge pending, 15CM3493.
AS to count 1:  Battery:  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-16 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, also to pay all ordered financial obligations in count 2, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
RECEIVED & FILED: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
AS to count 2: CDTP:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 41 days time served.   Court orders payment of all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation in count 1 and civil judgment if unpaid.
Defendant is remanded.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Luis E Torres in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 38. Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08/27/15 at 1:30pm in Branch 38.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Due to court calendar, case rescheduled to 8/27/2015 at 1:30 pm.

No PSI ordered.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court will amend bail conditions.

Court orders enhanced supervision to continue; the electronic monitoring is vacated.

As to Amended Count 1 and as to Count 2:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Amended Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 3  DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Luis E Torres in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Luis E Torres in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial received and filed.  The State turned over the available discovery to defense counsel.  The State will email an offer to defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 1:30 pm and Jury Trial on 6-29-2015 at 8:30 am.      mld

Defendant Luis E Torres in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Luis E Torres in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
